Html:
We're pleased to announce that MSDN now includes Beta documentation for some WPF Toolkit features:

 

DataGrid  http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.controls.datagrid(VS.100).aspx

DatePicker http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.controls.datepicker(VS.100).aspx

Calendar http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.controls.calendar(VS.100).aspx

Visual State Manager http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.visualstatemanager(VS.100).aspx

*Please note that these are not final documents and there are still blank topics on many features of the controls.  However, we'd like to begin collecting feedback on what we have as soon as possible to give us enough time to expand the documentation for the final release.

 

Much of this documentation was written based on questions and feedback from users on this forum, so thank you to everyone for your help!  As always, we are looking to improve the quality of our work - if you have any suggestions to improve this documentation (features that need clarification, FAQs which are not addressed, additional topics or samples which you'd like to see), please let us know!

 

Thanks,

The WPF Toolkit Team

When can we expect documentation for the charting controls?

Thanks

Unfortunately, I don't forsee getting official MSDN-style documentation for Charting anytime soon. For the time being, I hope that you find some of the existing blog content helpful - I've collected what I can here:

http://blogs.msdn.com/delay/archive/2009/07/19/my-new-home-page-enhanced-updated-collection-of-great-silverlight-wpf-data-visualization-resources.aspx

In particular, my own posts (grouped at the bottom) tend to be written with the intent of walking people through new concepts, etc..

Hope this helps!
